Dot points can be made with:  

- First dot point
- Second dot point
- Third dot point  

Lists can also be ordered by letters:  

a. First item
b. Second item
c. Third item  


Or Lists can be ordered by numbers:  

1. Item 1
2. Item 2
    a. Item 2a
    b. Item 2b
3. Item 3
    + Item 3a unordered
    + Item 3b unordered

You can print pretty tables using flextable like this:

```{r cars, ft.align="left", message=F, warning=F}
library(dplyr)
library(flextable)

head(mtcars) %>%
  flextable() %>%
  set_caption("Tables need a heading") %>%
  autofit()
```
